t: [junit] Tradeoff btw. right design and performance

<snip>

>Why I'm ask=
ing this question in JUint group is 'cause I started 
>practicing JUint rec=
ently and one of my badly-designed classes 
>happened to be untestable (cau=
se of such thought copling).
>As buffs of XP approach what do you preffer? =
Does it mean that every 
>time a unit test can't be written for a function =
the function must be 
>refactored?

"Go not to the Elves for counsel, for t=
hey will answer both yes and no!" (The same can be said for newsgroups and =
mailing lists! :-)

That said, the answer is yes and no. If you are able to=
 take the time and have suitable resources available, then obviously you sh=
ould refactor un-testable code until it is testable and provably correct. I=
f the boss is leaning on you for a release and the wailing and gnashing of =
teeth is too much for you to bear, then don't test it. Just remember that t=
here are very good reasons why XP adherents treat un-tested code like month=
 old smelly socks!

Simon
